citation.article-title: Salinibacterium xinjiangense sp. nov., a psychrophilic bacterium isolated from the China No. 1 glacier.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Salinibacterium xinjiangense sp. nov.
Salinibacterium xinjiangense (xin.jiang.en′se. N.L. neut. adj. xinjiangense pertaining to Xinjiang, where the type strain was isolated).
Cells are Gram-positive, psychrophilic, irregular rods, non-spore-forming, non-flagellated and non-gliding, 1.4–2.3 μm long and 0.5–0.8 μm wide.
Colonies are yellow, smooth, circular and convex with entire margins.
Grows at 4–23 °C and pH 5.0–9.0, with optimum growth at 18–19 °C and approximately pH 6.0–8.0.
Grows in the presence of 0–14 % (w/v) NaCl.
Hydrolyses starch and Tweens 20, 60 and 80, but not gelatin or casein.

Tests for arginine dihydrolase, lysine decarboxylase, ornithine decarboxylase, alkaline phosphatase, acid phosphatase, indole production, α-chymotrypsin, trypsin, urease, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, β-glucosidase, α-glucosidase and α-fucosidase are negative.
Tests for naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, α-mannosidase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), cystine arylamidase, leucine arylamidase and valine arylamidase are positive.
The following substrates are utilized as sole carbon sources: sucrose, glucose, cellobiose, d-mannose, melibiose, maltose, galactose, arabinose and fructose.
Acids are produced from glucose, fructose, d-mannose and galactose.
The following substrates are not utilized as sole carbon sources: melezitose, erythritol, sorbose, l-rhamnose, d-sorbitol, tartrate, pyruvate, fumarate, succinate, hippurate and uric acid.
The major menaquinone is MK-10, followed by a smaller amount of MK-11.
The polar lipids are diphosphatidylglycerol and phosphatidylglycerol.
The peptidoglycan contains ornithine and lysine as diamino acids, along with alanine, glycine and glutamic acid.
The major cellular fatty acids are anteiso-C15 : 0, iso-C16 : 0, iso-C14 : 0 and anteiso-C17 : 0 The genomic DNA G+C content of the type strain is 63.5 mol%.
The type strain is 0543T (=CGMCC 1.5381T =JCM 13926T), isolated from the China No. 1 glacier (Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region).
